thread.title: Brexit vote: Mic picks up moment MP mutters 'suicide' as House of Commons backs Brexit bill
thread.title_full: Brexit vote: Mic picks up moment MP mutters 'suicide' as House of Commons backs Brexit bill

author: Tom Powell
title: Brexit vote: Mic picks up moment MP mutters 'suicide' as House of Commons backs Brexit bill
text:
Shadow environment secretary and York Central MP Rachael Maskell and shadow equalities minister and Brent Central MP Dawn Butler both defied a three-line whip so they could vote in line with their heavily Remain-backing constituencies. 
Former chancellor Ken Clarke was the only Conservative to vote against the legislation. 
Social media has been rife with debate over which MP was behind the pessimistic prediction. Anyone who was in the Chamber know which MP said, 'suicide' as the vote tonight was announced? — Laura Kuenssberg (@bbclaurak) February 1, 2017 Who was is that muttered 'suicide' at the brexit result? — Bertie Barber (@BertieBarber) February 1, 2017 
Former Liberal Democrats leader Nick Clegg, Tory MP Ken Clarke and Labour MP for Ealing North Steve Pound are some of the names which have been suggested. 
Theresa May’s Brexit plan will be laid bare today for the first time when the government publishes its white paper. 
MPs are set to spend the day poring over the bill after backing it by 498 to 114 in a vote on Wednesday night. Legislation to allow PM to start formal Brexit talks clears first Commons hurdle 
The bill, which sets out the government’s strategy for triggering Article 50 and beginning the process of leaving the EU, will face major scrutiny before it becomes law. Read more
